test.question: A solar eclipse occurs when the moon blocks our view of the sun. Select the diagram that best represents the position of the sun, the Earth, and the moon during a solar eclipse, as well as the correct orbits
Convection currents of molten rock within the Earth mantle cause all the following EXCEPT
answers: movement of plates on Earth's crust.
flow of molten rock from cracks along the bottom of the ocean.

test.question: Which of the following does NOT cause changes in the Earth's surface, such as the formation of mountains and valleys?

The United States is in the Northern Hemisphere.

 Which statement(s) about the Southern Hemisphere is true? 

I. It is always warm in the Southern Hemisphere. 
II. When it's summer in the Northern Hemisphere, it is winter in the Southern Hemisphere. III. In the Southern Hemisphere, the sun sets in the east. 
IV. When it's winter in the Northern Hemisphere, it is summer in the SouthernHemisphere.
Humidity is a measure of
answers: the amount of water vapor in air.
test.answer: the amount of water vapor in air.

test.question: The Milky Way is estimated to be about 100,000 light-years across its larger diameter. A light-year is a measure of
answers: the number of stars in a galaxy.

test.question: According to the passage, the sun will eventually
answers: shrink and then run out of helium.
expand because it ran out of helium.
shrink because it ran out of hydrogen.

test.question: Based on this theory, the sun will, at some point, be a
Webbed feet enable ducks to swim better by
answers: increasing the surface area with which ducks propel water.
preventing particles from being stuck between the duck's toes.
increasing the rate of heat loss, so that ducks can cool down faster.
test.answer: increasing the surface area with which ducks propel water.

test.question: Determine how much water is in the graduated cylinder drawn below by reading the bottom of the meniscus (surface of water).

In addition to magnifying the image of an object, a microscope inverts the image left to right. The image of the object observed through the microscope is also upside down. Looking through the eyepiece, you would therefore see the upside-down mirror image of the object under the microscope lens.

 What would the object below look like if observed through the microscope?
Which one of the following statements is an opinion, rather than a fact?
answers: All organisms are made of one or more cells.
It's wrong to kill any organism.
test.answer: It's wrong to kill any organism.

test.question:
Here are a few experimental observations and known facts:

I. A scummy substance often forms in solutions of an amino acid in water. 
II. When the water is purified and exposed to UV radiation, the scummy substance does not form in the amino acid solution. 
III. UV radiation kills bacteria. 

What would be a valid hypothesis based on I, II and III?
answers: The scummy substance is a form of the amino acid.
The scummy substance would not appear if water were treated by a method, other than UV radiation, that kills bacteria.
The scummy substance is caused by organisms that humans are unable to detect.
The amino acid would not form the scummy substance in another galaxy.
UV light contributes to global warming.
test.answer: The scummy substance would not appear if water were treated by a method, other than UV radiation, that kills bacteria.

test.question:
Hypertension, or high blood pressure, is a condition that can lead to heart attack and stroke. A scientist graphed the following data collected from a study on hypertension. 

What is a logical conclusion based on the data?
answers: The prevalence of hypertension is higher than average in the 35-44 age group.
The prevalence of hypertension is highest in the 45-54 age group.
The prevalence of hypertension increases with age.
All senior citizens suffer from hypertension.
test.answer: The prevalence of hypertension increases with age.

test.question: The following pie chart illustrates the relative productivity (new plant material produced in one year) of different biomes. Based on the chart, which biome has the largest effect on the overall productivity?
Which trophic level suffered the greatest net loss (number of species) in diversity after pesticide use?
An atom will become an ion with the
answers: gain or loss of a proton.
gain or loss of an electron.
gain or loss of a neutron.
gain or loss of a nucleus
test.answer: gain or loss of an electron.

test.question: Which of the following is a physical change?
answers: carbon dioxide freezes to form dry ice
water is broken down into hydrogen and oxygen gas
an animal gets fatter from eating
milk is left outside and sours
test.answer: carbon dioxide freezes to form dry ice

test.question: The following graph shows how the concentration (amount per unit volume) changes with time. What information can be obtained from the data?
answers: The amount of reactant does not change with time.
The amount of product is decreasing.
The amount of reactant first decreases and then stays constant.
After 500 seconds, all of the reactant is used.
At 300 seconds, the concentration of the reactant is at maximum.
test.answer: The amount of reactant first decreases and then stays constant.

test.question: Which argument supporting the classification of Pluto as a planet is the weakest?
answers: Pluto orbits the sun just like the other eight planets.
Pluto, like the planet Mercury, has little or no atmosphere.
Pluto has been classified as a planet for more than sixty years since the discovery.
test.answer: Pluto has been classified as a planet for more than sixty years since the discovery.

test.question: Which one of the following statements is NOT backed with an explanation?
answers: Pluto should be grouped with planets known as gas giants.

test.question: The instrument shown in this picture can be used to study
answers: the movement of stars in other galaxies.

test.question:
A large surface area results in a high rate of cooling. This is why we tend to curl up when we sleep in a cold room and spread our limbs out when we sleep in a very hot room.

 Which of the following is an example where this principle is used in technology?
answers: Refrigerators can be used to cool containers of milk with large surface areas.
Fans that cool computers are often ribbed to increase the surface area for cooling.
Airplanes are shaped to minimize heat loss in the cabin.
Heat packs are designed to have a large surface area.
Microwave ovens are designed to completely close during food preparation.
test.answer: Fans that cool computers are often ribbed to increase the surface area for cooling.

test.question: The amount of dissolved gas in a liquid solution depends on the pressure of the gas. Under a high pressure, greater amounts of gas can be dissolved. The pressure is used to increase the solubility of carbon dioxide gas in
This instrument is used to
answers: determine the direction of the wind.
determine the directions of the world.
find the nearest piece of land when navigating the seas.
determine the direction of water flow.
test.answer: determine the directions of the world.

test.question: This instrument works because
answers: the needle points to the direction of minimum pressure.
the needle changes position depending on the position of the sun.
the Earth has two magnetic poles.
he temperatures on Earth's poles are very low.
test.answer: the Earth has two magnetic poles.

test.question: Based on the information in the passage, which statement about radioisotopes is false?
answers: A radioisotope can glow in the dark.
Einstein received the Nobel Prize for working with isotopes.
A radioisotope was used in watch dials.
test.answer: Einstein received the Nobel Prize for working with isotopes.

test.question: With which misconception about the Earth is the passage concerned?
answers: That the Earth was in the center of the solar system.
That the Earth was created at the same time as the sun.
That the Earth could be eclipsed by the sun.

test.question: Taking several iron supplements per day can
answers: decrease the chance of bone loss.
make up for an unbalanced diet.

test.question: Which of the minerals listed in the table are you most likely lacking if you experience irregular heartbeat?
Which two minerals are necessary for formation of healthy bones and teeth?
Which of the following is the most common result of prolonged excessive alcohol consumption?
Which of the following could be transmitted through kissing?
Through friction, energy of motion is converted to heat. You use this in your favor when you
answers: Wear gloves to make your hands warm.
Rub your hands together to make them warm.
Soak your hands with hot water to make them warm.
Place your hands near a fireplace to make them warm.
Hold a cup of tea to make your hands warm.
test.answer: Rub your hands together to make them warm.

test.question:
The boiling point of water decreases with increasing pressure. At high altitudes, the atmospheric pressure is lower than at sea level.

 Where would you expect to find the highest boiling point temperature of water?
answers: At the base of Mount Everest.
At the top of Mount Everest.
At the top of a small hill.
test.answer: At the top of Mount Everest.
